page.title: 01HILL TOP, S.E. OF TENBURY
page.content: Agriculture accounts for the majority of land use in the area, encompassing most types, including arable, dairy, beef, sheep and a little market gardening. There are a number of apple and cherry orchards in the area, some of which have only been planted in the last decade, although others are much older and less productive. there are a number of farms in the area, of various sizes; Hill Top being one of the larger ones which the Gough family have farmed for the last 20 years. Most of the stock is transported to markets at nearby Tenbury, which is only 4 miles away, or to Worcester or Kidderminster, both of which are a distance of about 16 miles. there is a wide variety in the housing in the area including a number of farmhouses, renovated farm cottages and some relatively new housing developments
